communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into heavy metal musician John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne (3 December 1948 – 22 July 2025) and/or his band, Black Sabbath. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/07/22/arts/music/ozzy-osbourne-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Public Records Request – BWC Footage – Arrest of Leann Nichole Weissbeck (6/21/23)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – BWC Footage – Arrest of Leann Nichole Weissbeck (6/21/23)
communications.communication:
To the Custodian of Records,

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I respectfully request access to the following public records:

All available video footage—including body-worn camera (BWC), dashcam, and in-vehicle (backseat) footage—related to the arrest of Leann Nichole Weissbeck on or about June 21, 2023, by officers of the Camdenton Police Department, including Officer Dylan Grindstaff (#636).

Please include footage that captures:

Initial officer contact

On-scene investigation

Arrest and transport

If footage from multiple officers or patrol units exists, I request all relevant perspectives. If any portion of the video is withheld, please cite the specific exemption and provide all reasonably segregable non-exempt portions.

I am requesting these records in electronic format and am willing to pay reasonable duplication costs. Please notify me in advance if there will be any fees.

Thank you for your time and assistance,

title: Public Records Request – BWC Footage – Arrest of Jaci Stevens (01/10/24)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – BWC Footage – Arrest of Jaci Stevens (01/10/24)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

related to the arrest of Jaci Casanne Stevens (10/29/1993), which occurred on January 10, 2024 at approximately 9:15 PM by the Ascension Parish 
Sheriff’s Office.

Specifically, I am requesting all available:
- Body-worn camera footage
- Dashcam footage
- In-vehicle footage (e.g. backseat transport)
- Any other on-scene or transport footage capturing:
 - Initial officer contact  
 - On-scene investigation  
 - Arrest and transport procedures  

If any footage from multiple deputies exists, I request all relevant perspectives. If any portion of the material is withheld, I request that you cite the specific exemption under Louisiana law and provide all reasonably segregable non-exempt portions.

I request this material in electronic format, and I am willing to pay reasonable duplication costs. Please inform me in advance if any fees will apply.

Thank you for your time and attention to this request.

title: Public Records Request – BWC Footage – Arrest of Inka Maria Jumisko (5/13/25)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Public Records Request – BWC Footage – Arrest of Inka Maria Jumisko (5/13/25)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), I respectfully request access to and copies of all available video footage related to the arrest of Inka Maria Jumisko, who was taken into custody by the Trinidad Police Department on or around May 13, 2025, following a fatal crash on southbound Interstate 25 near milepost 12. According to police reports, Ms. Jumisko was arrested on suspicion of vehicular homicide and driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or both.

Specifically, I am requesting:

Body-worn camera footage

Dashcam footage

Interior patrol vehicle (backseat) footage

Any video documenting the on-scene investigation and arrest process

Please include footage that captures:

Initial officer contact

On-scene investigation

Suspect interviews

Medical transport (if applicable)

Arrest and transport to the detention facility

If multiple officers were equipped with body cameras or dashcams, I request footage from all available perspectives. If any portion of the footage is withheld, please cite the specific exemption under CORA and release all reasonably segregable non-exempt portions.

I am requesting these records in electronic format and am willing to pay reasonable duplication costs. Please notify me in advance if any fees will apply.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Planning.

title: Public Records Request - Troop C - BWC Footage – Arrest of Justin Netherton (6/19/25)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Public Records Request - Troop C - BWC Footage – Arrest of Justin Netherton (6/19/25)
communications.communication:
Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I respectfully request access to and copies of all available video footage related to the arrest of Justin Netherton, which occurred on or after June 19, 2025, following a reported domestic dispute on Halsey Valley Road, in the Town of Spencer, Tioga County, NY. According to the public release by New York State Police, Mr. Netherton was arrested and charged with:

Assault in the second degree (Class D felony)

Resisting arrest (Class A misdemeanor)

Criminal mischief in the fourth degree (Class A misdemeanor)

Specifically, I request the following types of footage:

Body-worn camera footage

Dashcam footage

In-vehicle (backseat) footage, if available

Please include any footage that captures:

Initial officer contact with Mr. Netherton

On-scene investigation

Any use of force (e.g., Netherton throwing a beer can or kicking troopers)

The arrest process

Transport to the Tioga County Jail

If multiple officers were present and equipped with recording devices, I request footage from all relevant perspectives. If any portion of the footage is withheld, please cite the specific exemption under FOIL and provide all reasonably segregable, non-exempt portions.

I request these records in electronic format and am willing to pay reasonable duplication costs. Please notify me in advance if there will be any fees.

Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your response.

title: Public Records Request – BWC  Footage – Arrest of Christine Turner and Christina Yacalis (6/20/25)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Public Records Request – BWC  Footage – Arrest of Christine Turner and Christina Yacalis (6/20/25)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I am requesting access to and copies of all available body-worn camera (BWC), dash camera, and in-vehicle camera footage related to the arrest of Christine Turner and Christina Yacalis on or around June 20, 2025, in Binghamton, New York.

According to public reports, deputies from the Broome County Sheriff's Office responded to a stolen vehicle report originating from the Town of Maine on June 18. On June 20, deputies located the vehicle—a 2023 Hyundai Santa Fe SUV—on Sturges Street in Binghamton. The suspect, Christine Turner, fled from deputies, leading them through several city streets, including Bevier Street, State Street, and Route 363, before being stopped near Frederick Street.

Turner allegedly resisted commands and had to be forcibly removed from the vehicle. A passenger, Christina Yacalis, was also taken into custody. A subsequent search of the vehicle uncovered drugs including cocaine, fentanyl, and Alprazolam.

I am requesting any and all video that captures:

Initial vehicle stop

Pursuit and traffic violations

Officer commands and suspect responses

Use of force, if any

Arrest and detainment of both individuals

In-vehicle/backseat footage of transport, if applicable

If multiple deputies were on scene with BWC or vehicle cams, I request footage from all involved officers. If any portion of the footage is redacted or withheld, please cite the specific exemption being applied and release all non-exempt portions.

I request the records be provided electronically, and I am willing to pay reasonable duplication costs. Please notify me in advance if there will be any fees.

Thank you for your assistance.

title: Wisconsin Open Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Andi Anthony (12/9/24)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Wisconsin Open Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Andi Anthony (12/9/24)
communications.communication:
Dear Records Custodian,

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Law, I am requesting access to and copies of all records related to an incident that occurred on December 9, 2024, involving a vehicle crash into a house following a failed traffic stop in Grand Chute, WI.

According to public reports, around 2:00 p.m., a Grand Chute police officer attempted a traffic stop in the 4500 block of West Capitol Drive, after which the vehicle fled eastbound at a high rate of speed and ultimately crashed into a home in the 3100 block of the same road. Two suspects reportedly fled on foot and were apprehended with assistance from a police K-9 unit. Both suspects were injured and transported to a hospital. The Wisconsin State Patrol, Outagamie County Sheriff’s Office, Appleton Police, Grand Chute Fire, and Gold Cross Ambulance were also reported as assisting agencies.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera (BWC) footage from Grand Chute officers involved in or responding to the incident.

All in-car/dash camera footage from patrol vehicles.

Any photos, civilian video or reports related to damage to the residence struck by the vehicle.

If responsive records are held by assisting agencies (e.g., Wisconsin State Patrol), kindly indicate that in your response so I may redirect the request.

I prefer to receive these materials in electronic format. If fees apply, please inform me of the total in advance.

Thank you for your attention to this request.

title: Public Records Request - BWC Footage - Arrest of Jacqueline Polanco-Rodriguez (10/17/23)

communications.communication:

Incident Summary:
On or around October 17, 2023, Jacqueline Monique Polanco-Rodriguez was arrested by officers of the Yuba City Police Department.
According to publicly available information, she was booked on charges including 23103(A) VC – Reckless Driving, with a reported bond of $15,000.

Requested Records:
Please provide access to and copies of:

Body-worn camera (BWC) and in-vehicle camera footage from patrol vehicles, if applicable

If multiple officers or vehicles were involved, please include any footage from all relevant perspectives.

If fees apply, please inform me in advance. I prefer electronic delivery (via email or download link) if possible.

If you are not the appropriate agency for this request or if the arrest was handled jointly with another agency (such as the Sutter County Sheriff’s Office), I ask that you kindly forward this request or direct me to the correct contact.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

title: Public Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Michaela Lynch (3/3/25)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Michaela Lynch (3/3/25)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records,

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act § 25-19-101 et seq., 

I am requesting public records relating to an incident that occurred on March 3, 2025 at approximately 12:10 AM and led to the arrest of Michaela Lynch. The incident occurred near Highway 264 and Old Wire Road, and a subsequent stop was made at a pasture near a barbed wire fence following an attempted flight from law enforcement.

The investigation was initiated by Deputy Nathan Smith of the Benton County Sheriff’s Office, and ultimately resulted in arrests including that of Michaela Lynch, who was located hiding approximately 30 yards south of the vehicle.

Please provide the following records:

in-vehicle  and/or body-worn camera footage

I am requesting digital copies of these records. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me before fulfilling it. Should any part of the request be unclear or too broad, I would appreciate guidance on how to narrow it.

Thank you for your time and attention.
